title: A Plague Tale Collection Includes Both Games And A Cool Steelbook Case For Only $50
description: A Plague Tale Collection with Steelbook Case $50 Preorder at Amazon Preorder at Best Buy Preorder at Target Asobo Studio's incredible stealth-adventure games A Plague Tale: Innocence and A Plague Tale: Requiem are getting collected into a new steelbook bundle on PS5. Priced at $50, the A Plague Tale Collection will be available starting December 5, and preorders are available now at Amazon, Best Buy, and Target.A Plague Tale Collection$50Continue Reading at GameSpot

title: Deadpool & Wolverine Preorder: Walmart Restocks Steelbook, Amazon Discounts Standard 4K Blu-Ray
description: Deadpool & Wolverine 4K Blu-ray Limited Editions Only the Deadpool Steelbook Edition is in stock ahead of next week's launch. Preorder at Walmart Preorder at Amazon Preorder at Walmart (All Editions) Deadpool & Wolverine 4K Blu-ray The standard 4K Blu-ray edition is significantly cheaper. Preorder at Amazon Preorder at Walmart Deadpool and Wolverine releases on 4K Blu-ray next Tuesday, October 22. The biggest live-action film of 2024 has multiple limited editions, including an extremely popular pair of Deadpool and Wolverine 4K Steelbook Editions. The Deadpool Limited-Edition Steelbook has been restocked at Walmart and is available to preorder for $55. Amazon is sold out of the Deadpool Steelbook, so you'll want to secure your preorder at Walmart soon. Unfortunately, the Wolverine Steelbook is sold out at Amazon and Walmart.If you don't care about steelbook cases, the standard 4K Blu-ray edition of Deadpool & Wolverine is available to preorder for a markedly lower price at Amazon and Walmart. Deadpool & Wolverine's regular 4K Blu-ray is the No. 1 best-selling movie on Amazon. Walmart also has an exclusive standard Blu-ray edition with pop-up art that's discounted to $30 ahead of its release.Quick Look: Deadpool & Wolverine PreordersAmazonContinue Reading at GameSpot

title: Fall 2024 Lipstick Challenge, Day 3!
description: Iâ€™m a little surprised that I donâ€™t look more frazzled in this picture because about 20 minutes before I took it, I stumbled down the hill in our cul-de-sac like a Looney Tunes cartoon character! No seriously, I full-on rolled down a hill. We live in a neighborhood with tons of oak trees that produce these gigantic acorns, and as I was walking Connor down the hill to school I guess I wasnâ€™t really paying attention to where my feet were landing, so when I stepped on an acorn, which basically was like a massive marble, my right ankle rolled underneath me. That set off a chain reaction of me falling to the ground, and right as I hit the pavement, I reflexively tucked into a round ball, which then caused me to tumble down the steep hill even more as I clung onto Connorâ€™s little pink backpack with dear life! title: Remedy unveil wacky co-op shooter FBC: Firebreak, set in the Control universe
description: Alan Wake developers Remedy have announced their very first multiplayer game, a three-person co-op shooter set in the world of Control and thereby, the Remedy Connected Universe. Previously codenamed Condor, it's called FBC: Firebreak - and I am going to immediately recommend they shorten it to Firebreak, because that caps-into-colon combo is going to wind me up when I'm writing news posts at speed. While I'm throwing my weight around, let me also instantly rebut the pedants who are even now racing to leave a comment saying that, actually, Remedy did work on Smilegate's multiplayer shooter CrossfireX. Yes, they did, but only the single player bits. Anyway, Firebreak! Here's the announcement trailer. Read more
author: Edwin Evans-Thirlwell

title: Alan Wake 2 Lake House expansion trailer hints at Control 2 overlap, also features ghastly paint monsters
description: Remedy have released the first proper in-game trailer for Alan Wake 2's second expansion, The Lake House. It's billed as even more of a horror experience than the base game, and takes place in a research facility run by the Lynchian ghostbuster organisation you may have encountered in Remedy's paranormal shooter Control. As such, the expansion forms a direct connection between the games, and may - read: definitely will - harbour a few clues about the story of the forthcoming Control 2. Read more
author: Edwin Evans-Thirlwell

title: Former PlayStation exec says console makers "need to compete on content" instead of "fighting over teraflops"
description: Former PlayStation executive Shawn Layden has suggested the continuing push toward more powerful - and more costly - console hardware is unsustainable, arguing that "fighting over teraflops [is] no place to be... We need to compete on content". Read more
